etymology.description: Simplified from 行: the left side of the crossroads pictogram as seen from above; cf. the top component of 辵.
etymology.interpretation: Derived by isolating the left half of 行, an overhead view of a crossroads. The form came to signify a single step and, by extension, walking; it parallels the abbreviated top of 辵 in motion-related characters.

examples.chinese: 他独自彳亍在小巷中，思绪万千(他獨自彳亍在小巷中，思緒萬千)。
examples.pinyin: Tā dúzì chìchù zài xiǎoxiàng zhōng, sīxù wànqiān.
examples.english: He wandered slowly in the alley, lost in thought.

examples.chinese: 彳是部首之一，常见于表示行走的字(彳是部首之一，常見於表示行走的字)。
examples.pinyin: Chì shì bùshǒu zhī yī, chángjiàn yú biǎoshì xíngzǒu de zì.
examples.english: Rěn is one of the radicals, often seen in characters related to walking.

examples.chinese: 字典将“彳”读作“chì”，义为“行走、步”(字典將「彳」讀作「chì」，義為「行走、步」)。
examples.english: Dictionaries read “彳” as “chì,” meaning “to walk; step.”
